intro: Ichthyostomum, commonly known as the "fish mouth" alga, is a genus of unicellular, photosynthetic protists belonging to the order Peridiniales. These organisms are typically found in marine environments, where they play a role in the plankton community. Ichthyostomum species are characterized by their distinctive, elongated cell shape and the presence of two flagella, which aid in their motility. They possess chloroplasts containing chlorophyll a and c, enabling them to perform photosynthesis. Additionally, some species may form colonies, contributing to the ecological dynamics of their aquatic habitats.
